de.frauas.jdemandmodel.cli

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.frauas.jdemandmodel.cli.Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can be used to parse a command line. Its core method is the method "parse" that retrieves all information and fills the variables that can later be accessed by using the getters.
    Author:
    lukas

      • getResidentCount

        public int getResidentCount()
        Returns:
        the chosen number of residents, if not chosen, returns a default 2.

      • getMonth

        public int getMonth()
        Returns:
        the chosen month or default month 3.

      • isWeekend

        public boolean isWeekend()
        Returns:
        true if option "weekend" was set, otherwise false.

        Returns:
        the chosen time resolution, otherwise default 10.

      • getBulbConfig

        public int getBulbConfig()
        Returns:
        the chosen bulb configuration, if not chosen, returns -1 (random configuration)

      • getAppliances

        public de.frauas.jdemandmodel.appliance.Device[] getAppliances()
        Returns:
        a list of the chosen devices, else a random list of devices.

      • getFilename

        public java.lang.String getFilename()
        Returns:
        the chosen filename or a filename containing program title and timestamp.

      • getSeed

        public java.lang.String getSeed()
        Returns:
        the filename of the seed to be loaded or the current filename (for saving a seed).

      • printedOption

        public boolean printedOption()
        Returns:
        true, if printing options have been chosen, otherwise false

      • parse

        public void parse(java.lang.String[] args)
        This method parses the command line using the CommandLineParser and CommandLine class of the Apache Commons CLI (https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-cli/). When parsing, a ParseException can occur, e.g. unrecognized options or missing arguments. In this case, the program is terminated. However, unrecognized arguments are not covered by this and are checked for in a private method that, in positive case, will produce a warning. Finally, the result of the parsing is assessed. The method directly takes action for the options "help" and "app-list", as in those cases no simulation is needed. Another special case is the option "seed-input", as it demands a second call of this method, but with the command line that was used when running the original simulation. How to handle this can be seen in the class Main. Lastly, if non of the above options were chosen, the variables will be filled with the corresponding defaults or chosen values.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments passed to the program (command line)
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException - e.g. for unrecognized options or missing arguments
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - for options that require integers as arguments

      • initializeOptions

        private void initializeOptions()
        Initializes the options from the enum type CLIOptions. For further detail see CLIOptions.

      • checkForUnrecognizedArguments

        private void checkForUnrecognizedArguments()
        Unrecognized arguments are not covered by the ParseException and are checked for in this method.
        Throws:
        warning - prints a warning if unrecognized arguments were found.

      • checkCombined

        private void checkCombined(java.lang.String opt)
        This method checks whether an option is combined with another option. It should be used for the options "help", "app-list" and "seed-input". In case of combination it will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        opt - the option to be checked (should be "help", "app-list" or "seed")
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is more than one option

      • printAppliancesList

        private void printAppliancesList()
        This method represents the action taken when the option "app-list" was chosen. It prints a list of all possible device strings.
